djProfiles.name: Jonni Bryant
bio: He discovered 'Hard House' not by mistake but by an opportunity presenting itself to him and the universe gracing him with the sound that ultimately would never leave his side. From the age of 16, Jonni, had purchased his first pair of turntables. He had discovered pioneers within the industry that set him off on a path of self-discovery. At the age of 17 he experienced great loss through suicide and cancer, and with this loss he leaned on 'Hard House' to move forward with his life, and it then began to create opportunities within his adolescent life, that would change his life forever.

With events such as Sundissential, Polysexual, Godskitchen, Insomniacz and Progress from 2000, this propelled him forward to wanting to influence future generations through having these experiences. This led him onto attaining regular residency spots at events across the UK and Europe.
The Passion and drive instilled through this musical influence in his life has led him to starting his own brand, and further his production skills.
The vision is simple, to share my passion and love for electronic dance music to bring people together, and to create a unique sound and long-lasting memories.

djProfiles.name: Josh Brown
bio: Hailing from Coventry, DJ Josh B is our newest member of the TTLF Family.

Josh B purchased his first set of decks back in the year 2000 aged just 17! After 1 year of being a bedroom DJ, he secured his first weekly residency at Coventry's first hard house after club, the legendary 'FIDGET'.

From there Josh soon began his own monthly night called 'Satisfaction' which ran up until 2003. Josh then decided it was time to take his DJ skills to the wider international audience and secured a residency in 'STAR BEACH', Malia Greece, before moving to Leeds in the same year.

Josh currently lives back in Coventry and up until recently has been on pirate radio stations all across the Midlands but is hungry to bring back the days when he played at huge 'hard house' party's such as Sundissential North, B2t, Fidget and Crazy Daisy's to name but a few!
Josh B prides himself on his friendly but high energy performances on the decks whilst always playing 1 or 2 rare tunes that you may not of heard before!
We are proud to have him as our newest resident DJ, at TTLF!

djProfiles.name: Chris James
bio: Chris fell upon the harder sound in around the year 2001 when commercial trance style tunes just didn't cut it!

Sundissential then became the norm...and it defined him!  In 2002 he began dj'ing and whilst serving away mastered his craft. In 2004 he started to poke into the Birmingham based circuit and featured in afters parties such as Shaft & Shine.
The most notable and probably greatest achievement was playing alongside artists such as 12 inch thumpers, Ian M, Rafferty & Kershaw for Sundissential vs Afters!
The years that followed were littered with private and personal gigs in Germany mainly, but the love for the sound never faltered!

Now with a wisdom of understanding and a desire to keep the flame burning for our sound, Chris hopes to re-ignite the musical memory paths that you have embedded in your brain, to bring smiles and good times back to life.

djProfiles.name: Phil Wilson
bio: Born in the 80s raised in the 90s by modest folk from Birmingham, FiL-EP began his love affair with dance music when his family pulled together enough sheckles to buy the poor young boy a copy of the Prodigy's Experience album. After listening to this constantly day and night, at full blast and to the annoyance of everyone, there was no surprise he developed a taste for Hard House and Hard Dance in general.

In the early noughties raving hard on the Sundissential dance floor, giving big sweaty hugs to everyone 😉 he realised the one thing missing in his life was a set of decks. After spending many years perfecting some skill he managed to blag a gig on the pirate (at the time) radio station Mix FM with Birmingham based legends like DJ Wisk and Tony Moretti. FiL-EP had moved on from Hard House and Hard Dance by this time preferring Garage House, Deep House and Drum and Bass.

After a year of spinning tracks on Mix FM the young DJ decided to dabble in promoting putting events (not always music related) on at various venues including Subway City Birmingham this was too much work and he couldn't be arsed with it so he lost interest and decided to try a new hobby; eating……………..  and producing music. 🧐

University followed after failing horribly at the technical wizardry that was not foreseen, blagging himself 2 (yeh I can't believe it either) degrees in music production. This was to be his foundation on which to start a new career as a teacher. However, as life does circumstances changed and the balding 30 something needed to go back to doing some proper work and pack in this silly dream he had, had.

These days the old, fat, bald DJ has managed to blag a new gig with the wonderful people at Trip The Light Fantastic reigniting his Hard House loins and reminding him of slimmer, hairier times when you could be lost in the banging music with wonderful people on the dance floor thinking to yourself “man I'm in a mess where is everyone?”.

djProfiles.name: Melon
bio: I started my DJ career in my bedroom. I got my first break at a small event in Kidderminster. My style has always stayed true to UK Hardcore, Freeform, Powerstomp, Gabba, in this order, even throwing in some Happy Hardcore for good measure 😛.

I have had Residencies at club nights such as, 'Xtream Energy' where I played and helped organise the 'Pre-Parties' and 'After parties' for 'HTID' for 10 years, alongside the 'Awesome' promoter 'Wilfee C ' and 'Tony2pills'.
I became resident DJ for Random Xcitement, for Mr. MC Smilez and following this wicked achievement.
I started a radio show on Distinct FM with Smilez, Lewis T and Kieran Ryan, most Tuesday's. It was lots of fun.
I have played at Misfits for Smilez and the North East alliance in Wolverhampton. Lewis T and myself had a set with the legend Whizz-Kid.
I've DJ'd in Liverpool twice to see DJ Kurt, one of my tracks featured on his Power Stomp Vol.1 albums, 'Start the stomp' with Burtside.
I played Hardcore regularly at B2t for Strange Dave. I have played regularly at Rave to Raise, raising money for a great cancer charity.

Since my early DJ days to the current more modern era of underground dance music, I have decided to become more versatile and explore my turntablism skills by playing other genre's such as, Psytrance, Trance, Hard House and Drum N Bass, which I love.
Now with the opportunity to work alongside the wicked TTLF group it is time to see what 'Djing' has for me, for reading.

djProfiles.name: CK1
bio: I was 16 when I first discovered trance music. The year was 1999 (the year of trance as it is known). Going to various local nightclubs in Chesterfield for a couple of years until I discovered the ultimate club in the country at the time, the legendary Gatecrasher in Sheffield when I was 18.
From then on I attended all the main trance clubs and festivals in the U.K. including Godskitchen, Passion, Sugarshack, OTR, Goodgreef, Global Gathering and many more.

Having fallen in love with the sound of Eddie Halliwell in 2002 I decided to give DJing a go and bought my first pair of decks. A pair of KAM belt drives! Awful things but i learned the basics on them.

After a few years of playing at friend’s parties and going through various sets of decks including Technics 1210s, Vestax PDX 2000s, I finally settled on a pair of Stanton T120s which to this day I still view as the greatest turntables ever!

Over the years I started playing other styles of music including hard house, house music, clubland and speed garage. All of which I play to this day. I also started going to other events such as Sundissential, Storm, Insomniacz, Tidy and many more.

In 2005 I started my own event with a friend called Revolution (which still runs to this day). We played in a pub called the Anchor in Clowne twice a month for a couple of years until the pub closed. It was then time to start playing in other venues.

I soon got gigs at various clubs and have played at Back2Basics at Stinkeys Peephouse in Leeds, Send Off at Moo Club in Chesterfield, Vinyl4Play in Mansfield, Clubbed Up Sessions at Ice Nightclub in Ripley and many more.
A few major highlights for me were when I DJ’d in an amphitheatre in Egypt in 2019 and also played at a warm up gig for Cocoon in Dubai in 2020 both of which were incredible.
The most well-known DJ I have played with was Ultrabeat where I played the set just before he came on at a night called Digital Revolution.
I have taken a couple of breaks from DJing and clubbing over the years when my kids were born but never lost my love for the scene.
I have recently started dabbling in music production and hope to have a good understanding of this very soon.
I play every type of trance you can think of but my favourite sound at the minute is Paul Van Dyk. Love that uplifting bass driven sound!
Thanks for reading and I hope to see you at a future gig of ours very soon!
